com.jbion.utils.progress

Enum HeaderStyle

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<HeaderStyle>
      • com.jbion.utils.progress.HeaderStyle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<HeaderStyle>

    public enum HeaderStyle
extends Enum<HeaderStyle>
    An enum representing the different possible styles for the header of a AbstractProgressBar. The header is important for the user to know the length of bar, if it is not fully displayed. This situation happens when the console can't print \b or \r characters to remove the older bar.
    Author:
    Joffrey Bion

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ANGLES
      A line with angles using box drawing characters.
      LINE
      A thin ASCII line made out of underscore characters.
      NONE
      No header.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      char left
      The char for the header's left bound.
      char mid
      The char repeated in the header's middle part.
      char right
      The char for the header's right bound.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • NONE

        public static final HeaderStyle NONE
        No header.

      • LINE

        public static final HeaderStyle LINE
        A thin ASCII line made out of underscore characters.

      • ANGLES

        public static final HeaderStyle ANGLES
        A line with angles using box drawing characters. The header looks like the upper half of a thin and long rectangle.

    • Field Detail

      • left

        public final char left
        The char for the header's left bound. It is located right above BarStyle.left.

      • mid

        public final char mid
        The char repeated in the header's middle part.

      • right

        public final char right
        The char for the header's right bound. It is located right above BarStyle.right.
